court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
outcome: Annexure II final report filed on concluding the investigation in Crime No.1445 of 2015 of Alathur Police Station, Palakkad District and the proceedings in S.C.No.641/2016 registered on its basis are
full_text: BLA hl oud Blu ae IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2019/KER/976 PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MRS. JUSTICE MARY JOSEPH TUESDAY ,THE O8TH DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 18TH POUSHA, 1940 Cr1.MC.No. 8885 of 2018 CRIME NO. 1445/2015 OF Alathur Police Station , Palakkad District PETITIONER/ACCUSED 1 TO 3: 1 SANDEEP AGED 27 YEARS S/O.MANIKANTAN, NOCHIKKALPATTA HOUSE, CHITLACHERRY, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD. 2 AJESH AGED 34 YEARS S/O.KRISHNAN, NOCHIKKALPATTA HOUSE, CHITLACHERRY, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD. 3 RAMESH AGED 27 YEARS S/O.RAMAN, NOCHIKKALPATTA HOUSE, CHITLACHERRY, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD. BY ADV. SRI.T.K.SANDEEP RESPONDENTS/COMPLAINANT & STATE: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-31. 2 RATHEESH AGED 34 YEARS S/O.RAMAKRISHNAN, CHERUVANJIPARAMBU, KATHAMPOTTA, CHITLANCHERRY, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD-678510. R2 BY ADV. SRI.GOKUL DAS V.V.H. RI BY SRI. ALEX M. THOMBRA, SR.PUBLIC PROSECUTOR THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 08.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Liha bh Crl.MC.No.8885 of 2018 2 201KER/IT6 ORDER Annexure II final report filed on concluding the investigation in Crime No.1445 of 2015 of Alathur Police Station, Palakkad District and the proceedings in S.C.No.641/2016 registered on its basis are sought to be quashed in the present petition. The petition is filed by the three accused involved in the above crime jointly. 2. It is contended by Sri.Sandeep T.K., the learned counsel for petitioners that, the issues involved in the case have been settled amicably among the petitioners and the defacto complainant and an affidavit of the defacto complainant swearing to those aspects is produced along with the petition as Annexure III. He invited the attention of this Court to Annexure III. On a glance at the same, it is revealed that the issues involved in the case on hand were settled. The deponent of the affidavit is none other than the defacto complainant and he has sworn to the factum of settlement arrived at among himself and the petitioners and stated that, he maintains no grievance against the petitioners in view of the settlement arrived at and has no objection in quashing the proceedings initiated against them pursuant to Annexure II final report in Crime No.1445 of 2015 of Alathur Police Station, Palakkad District and S.C Liha bh Crl.MC.No.8885 of 2018 3 201KER/IT6 No.S.C.No.641/2016. 3. The learned Public Prosecutor was directed by this Court on 21.12.2018 to obtain instructions in the matter and holding an enquiry into it's veracity. The learned Public Prosecutor has submitted on the basis of the instructions obtained by him that, the submission of the learned counsel for the petitioner is true to facts. In the aforesaid circumstances, this Court is inclined to allow this petition. In the result, Crl.M.C stands allowed. Annexure-II final report laid by Alathur Police in Crime No.1445 of 2015 and all further proceedings initiated in S.C.No.641 of 2016 registered on the basis of Annexure-II by the Assistant Sessions Court, Palakkad stands quashed forthwith as against all the petitioners. sd/- MARY JOSEPH JUDGE NAB PR poeve| Bl ene Cr1.MC.No.8885 of 2018 4 2019/KERIS76 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S ANNEXURE: ANNEXURE I A TRUE COPY OF FIR IN CRIME NO.1445/2015 DATED 27/12/2015 OF ALATHUR POLICE STATION, PALAKKAD DISTRICT. ANNEXURE II A TRUE COPY OF FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.1445/2015 DATED 14/02/2016 OF ALATHUR POLICE STATION, PALAKKAD DIST. ANNEXURE III A TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN IN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT DATED 07/12/2018. RESPONDENT'S ANNEXURE: NIL //TRUE CoPpy// P A TO JUDGE
